IFreeRTOSObj Class Reference
FreeRTOS Wrapper Class

#include <IFreeRTOSProtocol.h>

Public Member Functions

virtual bool IsValid () const =0
virtual void Attach (xGenericHandle handle)=0

Detailed Description

This interface provide the basic behavior for all class in the FreeRTOS Wrapper layer. All objects in this layer must be able to manage the owned native FreeRTOS handle. When the handle is created it is attached to the object. From this moment the object owns the handle. When the object is disposed the handle is deleted and its resources are freed. It is possible to keep the underling native FreeRTOS handle alive by detaching it before the owner object is disposed.

Date:
Aug 5, 2010
Author:
Stefano Oliveri (STF12.net) E-Mail: software@stf12.net

Member Function Documentation

virtual void IFreeRTOSObj::Attach ( xGenericHandle  handle) [pure virtual]

Attach the object to a given FreeRTOS handle. A previous attached handle is deleted and its resource are freed.

Parameters:
handlespecifies a native FreeRTOS handle.

Implemented in ASyncObject, ATimer, CQueue, and CTask.

virtual xGenericHandle IFreeRTOSObj::Detach ( ) [pure virtual]

Usually a FreeRTOS handle is disposed and his resource freed when the attached object is deleted. Call this method to keep the handle alive.

Returns:
the native FreeRTOS handle. This handle is valid after the object is disposed.

Implemented in ASyncObject, ATimer, CQueue, and CTask.

virtual bool IFreeRTOSObj::IsValid ( ) const [pure virtual]

Check if the object is attached to a valid FreRTOS native handle.

Returns:
true if the is attached to a valid FreRTOS native handle, false otherwise.

Implemented in ASyncObject, ATimer, CQueue, and CTask.
